5_year_projection_calculations.name: Modeling Rules (Read First)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Sign discipline and guardrails for expression generation.
formulas: Treat expenses as negative in expressions. Do not add expenses to profits.
Never compute Interest Expense as a % of Revenue. Use debt balances only.
Exclude principal repayments from Interest Expense.
Gross Profit must be Revenue - COGS (subtract, do not add).
EBIT must be Gross Profit - SG&A - D&A (subtract both).
Net Income identity: Revenue - COGS - SG&A - D&A + Interest Income - Interest Expense - Tax Expense
If an input is unavailable (e.g., debt balance), return 0 for that row rather than making it revenue-based.

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Revenue
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Total income generated from sales of goods or services.
formulas: Revenue = Units Sold * Price per Unit
Revenue_t = Revenue_(t-1) * (1 + Growth Rate)

5_year_projection_calculations.name: COGS (Cost of Goods Sold)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Direct costs of producing goods/services sold.
formulas: COGS = Revenue * COGS%
COGS = Units Sold * Cost per Unit

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Gross Profit
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Profit after deducting direct production costs. SUBTRACT COGS DO NOT ADD
formulas: Gross Profit = Revenue - COGS
Example: if Revenue=997.5 and COGS=650.975 then Gross Profit = 997.5 - 650.975

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Gross Margin (%)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Gross profit as a percentage of revenue.
formulas: Gross Margin% = Gross Profit รท Revenue

5_year_projection_calculations.name: SG&A (Selling, General & Administrative Expenses)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Operating expenses not directly tied to production. Treat as an expense (negative in expressions).
formulas: SG&A = -Revenue * SG&A%
SG&A = -(Fixed Costs + (Variable Rate * Revenue))

5_year_projection_calculations.name: D&A (Depreciation & Amortization)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Non-cash expense. Treat as an expense (negative in expressions).
formulas: D&A = -Revenue * D&A%
D&A = -Depreciation Schedule Total

5_year_projection_calculations.name: EBIT (Earnings Before Interest & Taxes)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Operating profit before financing and tax. Subtract SG&A and D&A.
formulas: EBIT = Gross Profit - SG&A - D&A

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Interest Income
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Earnings from cash balances or investments.
formulas: Interest Income = Average Cash Balance * Interest Rate

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Interest Expense
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Cost of debt financing. Exclude principal repayments; never compute as a % of Revenue.
formulas: Interest Expense = Average Debt Balance * Interest Rate
If debt balance is unavailable, set Interest Expense = 0

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Profit Before Taxes (EBT)
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Profit before income tax is deducted.
formulas: EBT = EBIT + Interest Income - Interest Expense

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Tax Expenses
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Income taxes owed on pre-tax profit. If EBT <= 0, set Tax Expense = 0.
formulas: Tax Expense = EBT * Effective Tax Rate

5_year_projection_calculations.name: Net Income
5_year_projection_calculations.definition: Bottom-line profit after all expenses and taxes.
formulas: Net Income = EBT - Tax Expense
Net Income = Revenue - COGS - SG&A - D&A + Interest Income - Interest Expense - Tax Expense
